t: Mark 15
Jesus Faces Pilate
Immediately,*p in the morning, the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council; and they bound Jesus, led Him*i away, and delivered Him*i to Pilate.
Then Pilate asked Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?” He*p answered and said to him, “It*ir is*ir as*ir you*r say.”*r
And*p the chief priests accused Him of many things, but He answered nothing.
Then Pilate asked Him again, saying, “Do You answer nothing? See how many things they testify against You!”
But Jesus still answered nothing, so that Pilate marveled.
Taking the Place of Barabbas
Now*p at the feast he was accustomed to releasing one prisoner to them, whomever they requested.
And there was one named Barabbas, who*i was*i chained with his fellow rebels; they had committed murder in the rebellion.
Then the multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him*i to*i do*i just as he had always done for them.
But Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
For he knew that the chief priests had handed Him over because of envy.
But*p the chief priests stirred up the crowd, so that he should rather release Barabbas to them.
Pilate answered and said to them again, “What then do you want me to do with*i Him*i whom you call the King of the Jews?”
So*p they cried out again, “Crucify Him!”
Then*p Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has He done?” But*p they cried out all the more, “Crucify Him!”
So*p Pilate, wanting to gratify the crowd, released Barabbas to them; and he delivered Jesus, after he had scourged Him,*i to be crucified.
The Soldiers Mock Jesus
Then*p the soldiers led Him away into the hall called Praetorium, and they called together the whole garrison.
And they clothed Him with purple; and they twisted a crown of thorns, put it on His head,*i
and began to salute Him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
Then they struck Him on the head with a reed and spat on Him; and bowing the knee, they worshiped Him.
And when they had mocked Him, they took the purple off Him, put His own clothes on Him, and led Him out to crucify Him.
The King on a Cross
Then*p they compelled a certain man, Simon a Cyrenian, the father of Alexander and Rufus, as he was coming out of the country and passing by, to bear His cross.
And they brought Him to the place Golgotha, which is translated, Place of a Skull.
Then they gave Him wine mingled with myrrh to drink, but He did not take it.*i
And when they crucified Him, they divided His garments, casting lots for them to*i determine*i what every man should take.
Now*p it was the third hour, and they crucified Him.
And the inscription of His accusation was written above: THE*pc KING OF THE JEWS.
With*p Him they also crucified two robbers, one on His right and the other on His left.
So the Scripture was fulfilled which says, “And He was numbered with the transgressors.”
And*p those who passed by blasphemed Him, wagging their heads and saying, “Aha! You*i who destroy the temple and build it*i in three days,
save Yourself, and come down from the cross!”
Likewise*p the chief priests also, mocking among themselves with the scribes, said, “He saved others; Himself He cannot save.
Let the Christ, the King of Israel, descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe.” Even*p those who were crucified with Him reviled Him.
Jesus Dies on the Cross
Now*p when the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
And at the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi,*r Eloi,*r lama*r sabachthani?”*r which is translated, “My*r God,*r My*r God,*r why*r have*r You*r forsaken*r Me?”*r
Some*p of those who stood by, when they heard that,*i said, “Look, He is calling for Elijah!”
Then someone ran and filled a sponge full of sour wine, put it*i on a reed, and offered it*i to Him to drink, saying, “Let Him alone; let us see if Elijah will come to take Him down.”
And*p Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and breathed His last.
Then*p the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
So when the centurion, who stood opposite Him, saw that He cried out like this and breathed His last, he said, “Truly this Man was the Son of God!”
There*p were also women looking on from afar, among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the Less and of Joses, and Salome,
who also followed Him and ministered to Him when He was in Galilee, and many other women who came up with Him to Jerusalem.
Jesus Buried in Joseph’s Tomb
Now*p when evening had come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent council member, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, coming and taking courage, went in to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
Pilate marveled that He was already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him if He had been dead for some time.
So when he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.
Then he bought fine linen, took Him down, and wrapped Him in the linen. And he laid Him in a tomb which had been hewn out of the rock, and rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
And Mary Magdalene and Mary the*i mother*i of Joses observed where He was laid.
